books.name: Maharam Agenda
books.description: Founded in 1902, Maharam evolved from a pushcart business on the Lower East Side into a leading global textile resource for architects and interior designers. Hardcover. 232 pages. Four randomized cover variations.
books.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

books.name: Maharam Stories
books.description: Maharam Stories brings together a broad range of revealing and engaging design observations from luminaries such as Murray Moss, Hans Ulrich Obrist, John Pawson, Alice Rawsthorn, Michael Rock, Stefan Sagmeister, and more - packaged in a compelling design. Paperback. 284 pages.
books.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

books.name: Irving Harper Works in Paper
books.description: Known for his mid-century creation of the Marshmallow Sofa, Ball Clock, and Herman Miller logo as George Nelson Associates' director of design, Irving Harper made hundreds of rarely seen paper sculptures in his spare time from 1963-2000. Hardcover. 176 pages.

image: ./img/new/Books/Hella Jongerius I Don't Have a Favourite Color.png
books.name: Hella Jongerius: I Don't Have a Favourite Colour
books.description: Hella Jongerius describes her method of research and application to Vitra products.

books.name: Reproducing Scholten & Baijings
books.description: The first monograph on Dutch design duo Stefan Scholten and Carole Baijings takes an in-depth look at their research-intensive, hands-on, and iterative approach to making as demonstrated across seven case studies including those with 1616/Arita Japan, MINI, Georg Jensen, and Maharam. Hardcover. 348 pages.

books.name: Alexander Girard
books.description: A monograph on seminal designer Alexander Girard and his distinctive career.

books.name: Claudy Jongstra
books.description: This volume explore's Claudy Jonstra's distinctive, sustainable approach and provides an overview on her career.

books.name: The Colors of Sies Marjan
books.description: A colorful, comprehensive volume documenting the short-lived but highly influencial work of Sander Lak's beloved and now cult fashion brand, Sies Marjan.

books.name: Karel Martens: Full Colour
books.description: An intimate and  in-depth photographic documentation of the prolific Dutch graphic design of Karel Martens.

books.name: Studio Job & The Graninger Museum
books.description: The book traces a recent survey at the Groninger Museum in the Netherlands featuring 10 years of work by Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel, including the Bavaria Marquette series and Ruins on the end pages. Hardcover.

books.name: Irma Boom: Colour Based on Nature
books.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Booms previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.
books.Note: This item is no longer available and will not be reordered.

books.name: Jacob Hashimoto: Selected Kite Works & Installations
books.Note: This item will be available soon.

books.Note: This item will be available soon.
